did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Articles, reports, pamphlets, correspondence, minutes, publications.
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This collection consists of records and files from the Academy of Management.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records and files from the Academy of Management.
Included are office records, correspondence, convention files, publications files, and history files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: AoM Records #5289. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

Constitution, By-Laws, and Professional Division policy statement
Miscellaneous revisions of Constitution and By-Laws

scopecontent.p: Minutes of meetings, agenda items and attachments, correspondence related to meetings. Records are grouped by meeting date unless otherwise designated. Correspondence folders contain discussions on issues occurring between meetings. The Board consists of the following elected officers: Immediate Past President, President, President-Elect/Chairperson of Divisions, Vice President, 4 Professional Division Representatives, 2 Regional Division Representatives, 1 Representative-At-Large, and the following appointed officers: Editor, Academy of Management Journal, Editor, Academy of Management Review, Editor, Academy of Management Executive, and Secretary-Treasurer.
includes discussions re: reactivating the Academy

did.unittitle: Sub-Series 3. Manuals and handbooks: Includes manuals for executive officers and general handbooks produced for members, presenting Academy organization and policies.
Members Handbook, early draft and cost estimates

scopecontent.p: draft copy of first edition, April 1983
draft copy for use at April 21, 1983 Board of Governors meeting

did.unittitle: Sub-Series 4.Leadership Directories: Listing of the leaders for all Academy organizations, from national leaders to divisional leaders.
Sub-Series B. ANNUAL MEETINGS. Contains programs and correspondence.

scopecontent.p: Academy of Management executive officers progress through three offices: Vice President and Program Chair, President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, and President. The only contested election is for the position of Vice-President, after which the person elected automatically becomes President-Elect and then, President. Terms begin at the annual meeting in August. The Vice President is responsible for the planning and functioning of the Annual Meeting. The President-Elect is responsible for overseeing the Professional Divisions of the Academy. Included here are the files of the following officers: Ramon J. Aldag. President, 1991-1992; Arthur G. Bedeian. Vice President and Program Chair, 1986 1987; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1987 1988; President, 1988 - 1989; Janice M. Beyer. Vice President and Program Chair, 1988 1989; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1989 1990; President, 1990 1991; Alvin Brown. President, 1957; Larry L. Cummings. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1978 1979; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1979 1980; President, 1980 1981; Past President, 1981 1982; Keith Davis. President, 1964; Ralph C. Davis. President, 1948 ; Franklin E. Folts. President, 1953; William F. Glueck. President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1978 79; President, 1979 80; Billy E. Goetz. President, 1955; Paul J. Gordon. President, 1969 70; Don Hellriegel. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1985 86; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1986 87; President, 1987 88; Herbert G. Hicks. Associate Secretary Treasurer, 1970 - 71; Secretary Treasurer, 1971 - 72; Charles L. Jamison. Founder of the Academy of Management; Fremont E. Kast. President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1975 76; President, 1976 77; Steven Kerr. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1987 88; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1988 89; President, 1989 90; Harold Koontz. President, 1963; Joseph A. Litterer. President, 1970; John F. Mee. President, 1952; John B. Miner. President, 1978; Walter B. Newsom. Secretary-Treasurer and Business Manager, 1981 89; Rosemary Pledger. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1976 77; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1977 78; President, 1978 79; Dennis F. Ray. Secretary-Treasurer and Business Manager, 1976 79; Karl D. Reyer. Founder of the Academy of Management; Max D. Richards. President, 1967; Erwin H. Schell. President, 1950; John W. Slocum, Jr. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1973 74; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1974 75; President, 1975 76; Harold F. Smiddy. President, 1962; Richard M. Steers. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1984 85; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1985 86; President, 1986 87; George R. Terry. President, 1961; Stanley C. Vance. President, 1975 76; and Max S. Wortman. Vice President and Program Chairman, 1979 80; President-Elect and Coordinator of Professional Divisions, 1980 81; President, 1981 82.

did.unittitle: Sub-Series D. ACADEMY OF MANAGEMENT HISTORIANS RECORDS.

scopecontent.p: This office maintains materials of significant value regarding the history of the Academy. As of the date of this processing, Charles D. Wrege has been the only person to hold this office. The records emphasize the history of management theory and the Management History Division.
includes correspondence re: the Centennial of Modern Management, planned for 1986

At the National level, the Academy of Management operates many committees, both standing and ad-hoc. This series encompasses all the material emanating from those committees. It is arranged in hierarchical order with All-Academy standing committees first, followed by All-Academy ad-hoc committees. See Academy Handbooks, box 4, file folders 1 6 for more information.

scopecontent.p: Includes purpose and preliminary results of the questionnaire

Regional divisions function autonomously from the National Academy of Management, though they augment and complement its activities. They hold their own meetings and programs and develop their own membership requirements, Constitutions, and operating guidelines. There are five regional divisions: Eastern Academy of Management (EAM); Midwest Academy of Management; Southern Management Association, (SMA); Southwest Division; and Western Academy of Management.
